In fact, there are tunnels connecting things all through the area of the hotel, which are god options to get around without worrying about traffic, crossing streets, etc.One last advantage of the hotel is that it is a regular stop for the airport bus to Narita or Haneda. Unless you want to spend a lot more, or be a lot more frazzled by using public transportation, this is the best option from either airport.

We booked a stay of 7 days through Luxury Escapes, giving us a great launch pad from which to see Tokyo.The rooms were very comfortable, a good size with a comfortable bed and plenty of amenities.The breakfasts had a wide variety of choices and the staff at the ‘egg station’ were never flustered, no matter how many patrons and super efficient.Generally all the staff through out the hotel were very helpful.We were lucky to catch an offer through Luxury Escapes, for standard rooms with breakfast.All rooms have a view, due to the Hilton’s position.Loved the attention to detail in Marbles Bar, especially the Christmas decorations.Below there is a 24 hour convenience store and we walked to the main subway every day, rather than take the shuttle bus. This took around 20 minutes.(good exercise)Would love to stay again.

Really enjoyed the stay here.The courtesy bus shuttle to the nearby Shinjuku station is regular and makes transit to and from the shopping and train easy.Staff are great and all the food we tried was of a super high standard.If yo wish to walk to the action areas of Shijuku it takes about ten minutes.Head out and around the back of the hotel till you hit main road. Turn right, you will start seeing lights and it is fairly obvious which way you walk.Room is large, concierge was fabulous to get ideas and assistance from so a overall good stay in a busy hotel in the business end of town.

Tokyo has three "large" Hilton properties. I was expecting some tired 1972 hotel luxury but the Tokyo Hilton (even though it's cheaper than the Conrad Tokyo) is very nice, and quite recently built. Our bathroom (in Room 2519) included a huge unified 6' shower stall and massive porcelain soaking tub, so that during a shower you can stretch your arms out in many directions. You have to close up a modesty panel so that the person in the bed room section can't see directly into the windowed shower! The Hilton Tokyo (In the Shinjuku area) is halfway between two nearby subway stations, on different lines. Once you're free of your luggage, you can get to either of them from underground passages entered from the (modest) Hiltopia Mall-which has a stairway to the Hilton lobby. You have to go outdoors for no-stair subway access. We rolled our bags to the Tochomae station elevator. This is past the Hyatt front stairs entrance, and by TMG Tower #1, Observatory entrance. (That popular FREE observatory has a massive line, so we never went up.)We particularly liked the massive lobby breakfast buffet, but it's no bargain if you have to pay for it. When we don't have time for serious restaurant-going, we sometimes book Executive Rooms and subsist on free heavy hors d'ouvres for dinner. That worked fine here. The executive lounge is a rabbit-warren of multiple rooms, with not enough window seats. The staff doled out the window seats like restaurant hosts. The food was fine, but not a huge variety. It was very busy in the lounge, but we got the food and wine we needed.

Wow. This is on now every day until 25 December! The best Xmas dessert buffet ever so if you are in Tokyo you must try and get a spot! You may have to Queue but the line moves rapidly. Only $40 for a fabulous experience and beautiful decorations

Decided to try a hotel in Shinjuku as never stayed in this area in the past. Decided on the Hilton Tokyo. Must say this was the third Hilton we stayed in this year around the world and after this stay will be the last as we notice they all have poor sound proofing and provide poor sleep. Stayed four nights and initially booked a king Deluxe. Last minute upgraded to executive room and got a twin. Was a newly renovated room with nice looking washroom. Wall along the back if the washroom was glass and could move to see the room. Provides more light to the washroom. Room felt a bit small with the two twin beds. Hotel is in good location and has a shuttle to shinjuku station every 20 minutes. Provides easy access to food and shopping. Also has lower mall with a 24 hour store for food, drinks and amenities. Lower mall has an Italian and Indian restaurant. Also easy access to two subway lines. Unfortunately the sound proofing is not great. All night I could hear the upstairs guest stumping around his room. Could also hear occasional bangs when they would open the closet door or minibar door. I noticed this in our room when I opened the closet door. Complained and moved rooms to a higher floor on the 37th floor. Was not a renovated room but felt bigger as bathroom was smaller. Still poor sound proofing as could hear guests walking and opening snd closing doors. Two nights of poor sleep. Moved again to the 38th floor which is also not renovated. 37 and 38 floors will be renovated in 2019. Unfortunately still noisy from side guests. Anytime anyone opens the closet or minibar door you will hear a loud bang. Heard another guest complain about the same at the breakfast one morning. Executive lounge is good size and offers some food and drinks. Breakfast can be taken here or Marble buffet or a smaller Japanese breakfast in the sushi bar. Only has 15 seats so more quiet and intimate. Buffet is basic and not awesome, just average. Lounge is quiet during the day but at cocktail hour becomes a drink fest with loud boisterous tourists. Could hear conversations from other guests all the way down the room. People would drink and one group of three had 8 Asahi beer cans sitting on their table at one point. Staff try to clean but at times tables can be left uncleaned for a long period. No class either as I saw many people in shorts and flip flops (in November!!). Had the seafood buffet in Marble restaurant. Made reservations and asked to be seated away from the bar which allows smoking. Host wanted to seat us right in front of the bar when we arrived. I stated we had asked to be away from the bar and he replied all those other tables were reserved Yeah, we had a reservation too. He finally checked and moved us far away. We asked about a table and said it was reserved. People did not show up until 2 hours later and these were no even hotel guests. Many people in the restaurant were local young Japanese females out with friends. Who else comes with umbrellas and jackets. Did not see many people that looked like guests and restaurant was 1/2 empty. Overall the staff was nice and supervisor to the lounge apologized and helped us with the noisy rooms but I would not stay here again. Lobby is always busy and reception is always crowded. Hotel is too noisy in the rooms from poor sound proofing and too many guests. Too many other options to pick from in Tokyo that allows you to get a good sleep. Do not recommend this hotel to others Had a better stay at the Mercure Ginza.

We stayed 5 nights at this Hilton, where is located at Shinjuku area, with shuttle bus running between the Shinjuku station and hotel, but it’s also within walking distance between the two.Hotel lobby was busy and very energetic. Front desk agent Yui was wonderful and attentive. With the Hilton app, you can pre select your room, and they will upgrade it if you have enough status. Our suite was clean and big. The executive lounge provided a great option for morning breakfast and evening snacks. Also have coffee and soft drinks throughout the day. During the evening snack service if could get quite busy.The gym is around mid size with enough equipments, also have indoor swimming pool. In the men’s change room also have Japanese sauna and jacuzzi pool. Excellent restaurants choices within premises, from teppanyaki to steak house to buffet , all were wonderfully and worth trying. There is also a 24/7 convenient store down at basement, and provides great choice of items you need during the stay.Also, excellent concierge service, if you don’t know Tokyo well, just ask them. Their answer and suggestions were always helpful and detailed.It would probably be the best Hilton I’ve ever stayed at. Thanks to the great leadership from hotel management and all the hard working front line staff.If you ever wanna visit Tokyo, now you know where you can stay at.

We spent 3 nights here on a recent trip to Tokyo and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was a King Jr. Suite Executive. The room itself was very spacious. It had a king bed and a large area with 2 couches and table. We were with our teenager so they brought in a cot. We were informed by her that it was comfortable. The king bed was firm, but not as bad as we've heard they can be in Japan. The room was very nice and spacious but our bathroom was very small. Not a lot of wiggle room or counter space. This was our only negative experience in the stay. It was clean and stocked with nice towers and amenities. Water bottles were provided each day. We did miss the signature chocolate chip cookies. Not sure if they are served or not. They were not offered. The bathroom did have a window to the room with the blinds on the outside of the bathroom which gave our teen some pause. As honors members we were on an executive floor with access to the lounge for breakfast and lite dinner snacks. We took advantage of both and were very pleased. The breakfast had a nice variety of western as well as Japanese items and there was also a chef doing cook to order eggs. There is a lot of room in the lounge. You'll find a good variety of food, juices, coffee and other treats. At dinner time there was a nice variety of items and we had enough to call it a meal. There is beer and wine and other spirits as well as soft drinks and water. We did dine in one of the hotel restaurants and was pleased as well. We liked that the hotel was in a part of town that was close to all the sights we wanted to see. It is a short walk to public transportation and the hotel has a shuttle as well. If we ever are able to return to Tokyo we would stay here again.

This is my third time staying in this hotel. Location is nice. 5-6min walk to Shinjuku station and they have shuttlebus as well. Room is big, tidy and clean. The staffs are very friendly and supportive. There is Japanese breakfast for Hilton members which is very nice. Unfortunately, the hotel is full and very crowded at my stay. Overall experience is excellent.

We stayed for 7 nights as part of a luxury escapes package. The room itself was big for Japanese standards and the bed was comfy. The breakfast buffet was always busy but the staff were very attentative and there was a good selection of breakfast options. Location is good - about a 10-15 minute walk into shinjuku Station area. There is also a regular shuttle bus between the Hilton and shinjuku Station. The bathroom is a little on the small side and we had a combined bath/shower. For the price and luxury of this hotel, I would've expected a free standing shower. Otherwise our stay was faultless and I'd definitely stay here again.

Stayed at Hilton Tokyo for 5 days. Very good hotel and convenient located close to Tokyo Metro, Japan Rail and a 6 min short walk to Shinjuku Station and surrounding shops/restaurants. 2 Metro lines are infact accessible direct from inside the hotel. If I’m going back to Tokyo someday I will return to Hilton Tokyo.

I stayed for 5 nights on business. Great location. The stay was excellent with a complimentary upgraded room with a great view. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. The breakfast buffet had all you could want. The executive lounge had a great view. The staff was friendly and accommodating. My only criticisms are the crowds in the lobby and the firmness of the bed. Neither would deter me from returning. Highly recommended.

I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I found it to be a very nice hotel. Because we are Hilton Honors members, we received an upgrade to a suite. It was an excellent room with lots of space and a great view of the area at night. It is a big and very busy hotel, so if you prefer a smaller hotel, this one would not be the one for you. The staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. There is a shuttle to the shopping area and a large train station that makes it easy to get anywhere in Tokyo. I would recommend this hotel for those who like a large hotel with several restaurants and bars.

Completely with 3 restaurants and a swimming pool with hot tub, Hilton Tokyo Narita Airport is 10 minutes from Narita Airport on the free airport shuttle. Rooms amazing view include a spacious bathroom with bathtub. We spent 1 night before leaving for Vietnam. We will be back if we had a change

Stayed here for 5 nights from a Luxury Escape deal we have purchased. This was our first stop to our japan trip and is the hotel we were most excited for as it’s meant to be a 5 star hotel.Good:-direct Airport Limousine Bus from Haneda as such not a hassle to get to the hotel-free shuttle services to Shinjuku stationBad:- as it’s a business hotel, lifts are often very packed and it’s a long journey going up and down. Lobby is always full of people and noisy. Breakfast was a pain to get any food-we were not informed that the hotel is directly connected to 2 subway stations. We had to discover that ourselves on our last night.-we were not informed on the free shuttle bus until we have discovered it.- room size is average, but the toilet is very small and bad exhaust in which the toilet is often fogged up. - shuttle bus is free to the public as such is often full and you have to wait 20 minutes for the next one Would not come back to stay as I think I would rather pay that money at a 3.5-4 star hotel with newer rooms and better location.

This is a lovely city hotel. Nice shopping centre to eat out if you't want to eat at the hotel. Great breakfast and dinner buffett, though the executive lounge canapes can be improved. The newly decorated rooms are beautiful and spacious. Though the bathrooms seemed like an afterthought. Bath was very small, so was the shower area.

Excellent stay. Helpful staff. Nice big rooms. Diamond benefits as its finest (executive lounge, breakfast, room upgrade etc.). Good location, close to the Shinjuku station. The free transfer was also nice and reliable.

After our cruise we went from Yokohama to Tokyo by train. We wanted to stay in the Shinjuku-ku area. We selected Hilton Tokyo for it's convenience. We arrived at the Shinjuku station and went upstairs and outside to bus stop #21 in front of the Kelo Department store. Very shortly a Hilton bus arrived and took us to our hotel. When the bus arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a young lady who took our bags and brought them into the lobby. The Hotel was full due to a Holiday week going thru the weekend into Monday. When I went to the front desk, I was greeted by Yuhsuke Kasano, Assistant Front Office Manager. He mentioned the Hotel was full, but would try to find a room for us. In about five minutes, he found us a room on the 27 floor that we could immediately use. He noticed we were gold status and extended to us access to the Executive lounge. He mentioned we had complimentary breakfast at three different locations. He recommended we try the typical Japanese breakfast and reservations were required. We made reservations for the breakfast. We went to our room and our bags arrived about 15 minutes after being in our room. The room was ample for our needs. We requested extra pillows, including the rice pillow and they were delivered to our room. That evening we went to the Executive Lounge where there were food and drink selections. We meet some new friends and every evening we would meet and stay till the Lounge closed. For breakfast, in the lobby area was a vast selection of Japanese and American/European items. We ate there twice and enjoyed our breakfast. One morning we had the typical Japanese breakfast. It was an interesting experience which we enjoyed. On our final day we arranged the bus shuttle from our hotel to Narita Airport.Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. When in Tokyo, we would differently stay at the Tokyo Hilton.

Great property. One of the best Hilton locations I’ve ever stayed. Great bar and warm staff. We had dinner at Junisoh with the Assistant head sushi chef, Masao Koyama, it was a pleasure to watch him work while we ate. Wonderful experience, truly awesome chef.

It's our first time in this hotel and we loved everything about it! The service here is excellent. Special thanks to Harumi in the Concierge desk who helped us with making arraignments for our anniversary dinner! The rooms are nice and clean. If you are a Hilton gold and platinum member, there is a executive lounge on the 37th floor for breakfast, snacks, and evenings drinks. There is also a separate room on same floor where it is more private and there is alcohol! Also, if you are Hilton Gold and platinum, there is a traditional Japanese breakfast on the 2nd floor at Junisoh, excellent! This hotel is conveniently located a few blocks away from Family Mart convenience stores and the subway. Thank you Hilton Tokyo and all your staff for making our 1st visit to Toykyo memorable!

I keep coming back to Hilton in Shinjuku because the staff is extremely efficient, friendly, and go out of your way to make sure you have an enjoyable stay. Ernesto Bressan at the front desk is a delight to communicate with - he does his best to accommodate your requests. Yukhi at the front desk too, not only checked me out but took care of my bags for the bus to the aiport. Shingo at concierge got me a box, mailed my postcards, and made reservations for my bus service. Especially for such a busy hotel, they have impeccable service. This is the only place I’ll stay at in tokyo.

Have stayed at this hotel numerous times as like the location, upgrades offered for Diamond members and service at the Executive lounge.The lounge will close for most of the spring season in early January for refurbishments and rightfully so. I hope that they expand the space because the ambiance resembled that of an Indian bus station when I checked in during the evening happy hour with no space to sit.The employees apologized and there were some guests leaving soon and space opened up.

This hotel is well located to walk or take the metro, and taxi's readily available. It was easy to navigate the hotel, staff were excellent, spoke multiple languages, and very helpful, this is a good family option.

We had no idea where this hotel actually was but it was one of the stops on the limousine bus from the airport so we figured it was in a good place. It turned out to be very convenient. There was a subway stop accessible inside the building. The room was very nice and clean. We had breakfast at the hotel which was good but pricey. We appreciated the hotel allowed us a late checkout to give us a little more time in this wonderful city.

Arrival: We took the Friendly Limousine Bus from Narita Airport, which dropped us right at the doorstep of the hotel. Travel time took close to 2 hours because we arrived sometime in the afternoon on a weekday.Check-in: It was quick even though there were a lot of people in the lobby. (Well, most of them were there for the dessert buffet.) We were in our room 10-15 minutes after we arrived.Room: Our room was a Junior Suite, around 44 square meters, which is quite spacious by Japanese standards. It is an open concept suite so there were no division between the living room and the bedroom. The windows are done in Japanese style and there are two Yukata available in the drawer. The bathroom has a tub and standard Japanese toilet.Executive Lounge: The lounge may, at first, seem small but it's actually spacious divided by a small hallway. Drinks are excellent with many options especially during cocktail hours. Also has a nice selection of premium teas. I heard that they will be renovating it by January so it can only improve from thereon.Breakfast: Since we had lounge access, we had three breakfast options. First at the lounge, second at the full buffet at Marble Lounge on the ground floor, and third at Junisoh Japanese restaurant at the 2nd floor. We tried them all during our five days of stay. The lounge has good enough option and it's definitely less crowded than the Marble Lounge--but the Marble Lounge has more options. Junisoh breakfast is a must try for those wanting to learn a little bit about the Japanese Diet Philosophy of eating only up to 80%. It's a bento box style that's best enjoyed slowly and with great relish.Service: Service was topnotch. During our last two nights, which fell on a weekend, the lounge during cocktail hours was quite crowded but they managed to seat everyone at a reasonable time. They were also helpful in providing us maps, directions, and the Concierge let us borrow an umbrella during one day when it rained.Getting Around: There is a shuttle going to and from Shinjuku station every 20 minutes so it's not a hassle. Also, it's actually quite walkable to Shinjuku station, excellent during cool weather, as it gives you a chance to admire the tall magnificent buildings in Shinjuku.Lastly, kudos to whoever is managing the Hilton Tokyo Instagram account for being interactive and funny! :-)All in all, an excellent hotel in Tokyo right in Shinjuku. Will definitely stay again when I'm in Tokyo.

It has been my second time to Hilton Shinjuku this year and I love this hotel, first due to the location and second is the quality of breakfast and the staff service. Room is clean and tidy. Will definitely revisit again

We had two separate stays in the hotel. Both in the same both,so Im speaking generally for both stays, just different rooms.Check inThe moment you enter the hotel, there is a sweet smell all over the place in the lobby. The lobby its very big and there was a lot of managers doing check in, so we didn't wait. RoomsSuperior roomWe were 3 persons sleeping in different beds, so it was a bit crampy. We used the hotel only for sleep and shower, since we went sightseeing all day. It wasn't that bad, but still, expensive for the room we get. Amenities in the room included coffee (nescafe was a great one) and tea. No cream, so we bought our own.Upgraded to executive suite for 2nd stay.This room was a way more big that the superior room,only downsided, was that it meant to be for the 2 queen beds, and has amenities like a big sofa with huge coffee table in the middle. I imagine it would be very nice if we only had that 2 beds, but we asked for a 3rd bed and the layout was super weird. We were moving all the room to see the best fit for our little 2 night stay.Amenities in the room included a fancy nespresso coffee machine, plus the amenities from the superior room.BedsThis is one of the best rollaway beds I had in an hotel.It was super comfortable!Breakfast buffetOne day we had the prix fix menu at the marble lounge. It was super good portioned. It included cereal, fruit, pastries, yogurth, juice, coffee or tea etc. I didn't finished the whole thing.Another day, had the breakfast buffet at same location, but choose the buffet. It was so good. With oriental and occidental choices. I personally loved the skinny french toast, was amazing!Shuttle serviceSuper punctual, fast and efficient.Business centerThere was 2 macs and 2 windows pc. One of the macs was very slow and the windows one was out or order.Concierge serviceThey were very helpful. From lent us an adaptor,to had several baggage taken care of for 9 days until our return to the hotel. They also provided timetables and reservations for the airport limousine between other stuff.The areaAs others says, this is not the Shinjuku area you see on tv. Its a little far away from it, but for that you have the shuttle service.We found the area good to stay, since it was very peaceful and had a super market open 24 hrs. just 2 blocks away.Also, had several cafes around and a Dennys restaurant.There is a park almost in front of the hotel (Central park Shinjuku) which was small but lovely. I had a run over there and there were other people doing so. Overall, I had a good stay here. I would recomend it and I would stay here again.

The Hotel is in Shinjuku area, it is a good location for business. Close by Shinjuku train station.The rooms have been renewed and the service is very good. All personnel is looking to make your stay as agreeable as possible.The Gym is a bit small with only one machine and free weights, but there is enough cardio machines.

I have stayed at this hotel on three separate vacations over the past three years and I plan on arriving next week for my fourth trip! In anticipation of my fourth trip I got in touch with the concierge, specifically Manami,Sato.She once again produced OUTSTANDING service and I can strongly recommend their concierge services. Always a smiling face to help

nice hotel with friendly staff. Shuttle from train station makes it convenient for using it as a base. Very nice seafood buffet, but need reservations. Underground walkway to subway. Bathrooms are a bit dated, but rooms themselves clean

My family stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and liked it. The staff was professional and helpful. Our room was comfortable and the view from our room was great. There are a couple of minor issues that I would like to point out and hopefully they can fix them in the future.The Executive Lounge is open until 9PM. However I went there once at 8:30PM and all food was gone.The grilled salmon in breakfast has a lot of small bones. It's inconvenient to feed this to our kid.Somehow a few major Chinese websites such as Weibo are partially blocked by the hotel's internet connection. I had to use 4G cellular to access those websites.

Stayed here for 9 nights with my partner, really amazing views from our room and brilliant food! We had breakfast included and it was really delicious. TIP - Only thing i would advise is we had no idea they needed a £600 deposit upon arrival and because we didn't own a credit card we had to use ¥90,000! Which was a third of our spending money each so that was a real shock. Would have been totally fine if we knew in advance. That really did cause some stress.

This is the second review of a Hilton Hotel I have given and this is the last time I will stay in a Hilton Hotel. On a positive note the bed was really comfortable! The breakfast was good but was extremely busy. Reception staff had limited to no English so when we asked where to transfer our pre paid voucher into a JR pass we were given another map with railway stations marked. After a day of going from station to station ticket officer to ticket office we were extremely confused and exhausted. The front desk staff were off hand and showed no interest. I think they should get assistance from someone who can speak a little English to help. Finally we approached a gentleman who was the only staff member who understood what we were talking about and along with a very helpful man from concierge went out of their way to help us find the correct location. The hotel is a long way from restaurants so therefore you have to use the hotel facilities and pay exhorbitant fees of around 24% in taxes in service fees and consumption on top of very high prices in food. The Zetta bar was the same having staff with limited English and Off hand and not friendly. . If you pay such high rates you expect service and a pleasant evening but not so at this Hilton. We were very happy to leave Tokyo as this experienced marred our holiday and view of Tokyo in general.

Great Hotel in general, nice clean unpretensious rooms, good food and amazing breakfast, great experience in general for a business trip.Location is a bit far from more touristic places but you can go shopping and or walk to parks nearby, getting to more popular places requires either a significant walk or public transportation (I loved the Uber experience in Tokyo by the way!)Excellent cigar and wine bars, a pity though that alcohol sales in the cigar bar ended up quite early (by 11:00 pm if I remember right)Nice experience.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton for our last few days in Japan. It was definitely a good place to end the trip. Though it wasn't the most luxurious of the hotels we'd stayed in, it certainly lived up to the Hilton name. We'd arrived at the hotel early and were pretty sure we weren't going to get a room right away, but they got us a room immediately, which was great because it allowed us to rest for a little bit before exploring Shinjuku.The hotel itself is in a great location, close to all sorts of awesome sights, places to shop, and restaurants. You really can't beat the location! The room was a good size considering it was in Tokyo and the bathroom was very nice and clean. The breakfast was very nice, with a good selection of different kinds of food, though it's very clear it caters to a western clientele. The entire hotel is very obviously catering to westerners and has an American feel to it, which is I suppose to be expected considering it's a Hilton. That being said, we had dinner at the japanese restaurant on our last night and it was one of the best meals of our trip. They even had wagyu beef, which my boyfriend absolutely loved. I'm a pescatarian so I stuck to the set meal with sushi in it. Though I did notice that I had told the server I didn't eat meat and yet the appetizer served to me had chicken in it. I suspect this was more my bad for not being more specific, though- maybe she thought I meant only red meat. The appetizer was such a small part of the meal though, I just gave it to my boyfriend and happily ate the rest of my food, no problem. It was also very helpful that the hotel offers a shuttle service to the airports. It isn't free and I believe it's more expensive than taking the train there, but in my opinion it was worth it for the convenience of it. That way we didn't need to worry about taking the trains with all our luggage, or any uncertainty about timing, since they knew exactly what length of time it'd take to get there (it's about two hours). All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much! The service was excellent and all the staff were so cheerful and helpful. Would gladly stay here again.

I stayed at this property for five nights. It was a reward stay and I paid points for four nights and received the fifth night free. So this was a great value to me. As a Hilton Gold member, I did not receive Exec Lounge access, but I was not expecting that.I did receive a wonderful room upgrade to a king bed. The room was large, high up with a wonderful view and a huge bathroom with a walk in shower. The AC was strong and quiet, there was a chair and a desk and also a chair/ottoman set up. Plugs by the bed and the desk area. Housekeeping was done so well during my 5 days stay. Everything was replaced, replenished, cleaned, etc. It was spotless every day. I had a kettle in my room and coffee/tea set. There was a minibar with a little room for snacks that I would buy at the convenient store in the basement.Breakfast in the lobby restaurant was really well done. I found the food delicious, lots of choices, and it never got too crowded. I would be there around 7. Lobby is busy but the staff is very helpful. I used the luggage forwarding service in the lobby to have my bags sent on to the next hotel. This is VERY USEFUL when you are traveling in Japan by public transit as your bag is in your next hotel room when you check in. I think the fee was around $10 for one bag to Yokohama. It was charged to the room. Very well done and worth it. Even though I found the transit station near the hotel very convenient, I would often take the shuttle to Shinjuku station since there are so many great eating places near the station. This was a great stay. It is a large busy hotel, and, while the service was excellent, its too big to be very personal, and that is just fine for me and appropriate in a place like Tokyo. The price was right for me, as I was paying with points, but the rates were high when I stayed there. But that is for a world class city hotel in a city known for high priced hotels. This is a landmark hotel and I was thrilled to be able to experience it.

We are Hilton honors and are accustomed to the Hilton brand so we know what we will be getting and it’s always a safe bet. This Hilton was good but it wasn’t great. The not great: This is in the business location of Shinjuku and it’s a 20+ minute walk to the other side of Shinjuku and there isn’t very much in the area. We did find a Starbucks, a 7-11, Denny’s and a convenience store all within a block of the hotel but otherwise it’s very sparse.There is not a hang out area in the lobby. There are a couple of seats but there is no where to sit and wait or kill time in the lobby area. If we were waiting for a tour guide or just each other we would have to stand in the lobby as all the seats about 10 of them total were always taken.The bathroom is a hot mess. Yes it’s Tokyo yes it’s small but the real issue here is that there is no glass enclosure or curtain for the shower and so you get water everywhere on on everything since it’s such a tight space. We were not told about the free shuttle to Shinjuku Station and can I tell you this would have been life changing for us. I saw it out front on our last day and had to inquire about it. Luckily we were able to use it to get our luggage to the station. I wish upon check in or in the paperwork they sent be upon booking they would have let us know about it. It would have made getting to the hotel so so much easier.Any noise from the hallways can be heard in your room so anyone walking Dow the hall talking can be disturbing.There are no electrical outlets near the nightstands to charge your phones. I like to use my phone before bed and just charge it up and leave it next to me but I had to always get up and go put it up. I use my phone as an alarm so it was always on the other side in the mornings so no snooze button for me. The good:The room was very nice size, the bed was comfortable the room was clean and the view was beautiful. We stayed on the 26th floor. The A/C was quiet and worked wonderfully the room was also dark and easy to sleep in. The bar on the 2nd floor was also lovely we spend some time there on the first night. Spacious great music and service. There is a convenience store in the mall in the basement of the hotel. You can go here for drinks and snacks and most mornings we would get coffee and pastries from here to start the day. I would stay here again but would prefer a better location for tourism if I could find it.

We took a trans pacific cruise from Vancouver to Tokyo . This was our first visit to Tokyo and the Hilton was the right choice for our 3 night stay in town We fortunately were upgraded to the Executive level, and WOW, what a great experience The views were phenomenal and the food / drinks/ service were outstanding. They have a free shuttle to the Shinjuku train station, but if you like walking, it's a 10 minute hike . So glad to be a Hilton Honors member, and worth every stay

I stayed for two nights as part of a longer trip around Japan. Worth noting that I’m a Hilton diamond member.Location: off the red line, there is direct access via the under ground passage ways if you head towards the Tokyo metropolitian government building / Hiltopia, it might not be that easy to find first time. I went over ground the first time, then left the hotel via the underground afterwards. I thought the location was fairly central but to be fair there didn’t seem to be a lot to do immediately around the hotel (except the observation deck in the government building). But you are only one station from Shinjuku so not really a problem. Plus I love the hotel so much that I can overlook this. Room: best upgrade I have ever got, junior suite. It was huge, and lovely. Even thou I’m not that noise sensitive I was worried that I was right by the elevator. I’m pretty sure I heard noise like once, which is pretty amazing. I think the blinds/shutters must be noise blocking too, as despite being next to a hospital I only heard an ambulance once! I was on the 16th floor. The air con made a tiny noise that I notice sometimes but only because the room was so quiet! The elevators were pretty quick. The sofa was comfortable, as was the bed. The toiletries were Crabtree and Evelyn. I enjoyed having a tea set in the room. The shower pressure was excellent, but I found the bath in the wet room set up a little odd, and it look me a while to find a good angle for the shower head so that I wasn’t backed into the bath. It also made the bathroom a little smaller than it could have been. I find having a moving shutter outside the bathroom a bit odd, if you were sharing the room with someone then you need to trust they don’t open it whilst you are showering. I also assume they can see a shadow of you in the shower?Lounge access: I got that via my status. I tried afternoon tea - excellent lots of choices of cakes, all western. Also tried pre dinner snacks, you could probably make a meal out of it. I don’t drink but saw wine and spirit.Breakfast: Free with status, I didn’t try the Japanese breakfast which needs booking in advance. The marble lounge breakfast buffet was amazing, western and Asian option, especially love that they offer soya milk, I saw soya smoothie too but did not try it.I had minimal interaction with staff, I was granted late checkout (my request 2pm) but did not use it in the end.If I had to nit pick:- the lobby always seems busy. I waited a bit at checkin, no real waiting at check out. - I really don’t like that the clean towels are stored right next to the toilet paper holder, doesn’t seem very hygienic to me.If you have right Hilton status, the perks are really great here, I would definitely recommend staying. Best Hilton stay to date!

Beautiful hotel, very clean including rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, convienient to subway which is just below the hotel along with a shopping area. Great restaurants including the buffet and Chinese restaurant.

This hotel worked wonders on a recent two-night stay. It is well cared for, well laid out, and perfectly staffed. While the rooms are not huge in isolation, they are quite large when considering that the hotel is in Tokyo, with a bathroom that is superior to nearby competitors. Also, while this is a quiet-on-the-weekend, business focused area, it has amazing transit options, including for the N'Ex train, and you can still walk to a lot of things in a short period of time in good weather.

I was excited to stay at this hotel. The reviews were glowing, but we were so terribly disappointed--this was most definitely not a 5-star hotel, and I'm not even sure what measures were used to rate it as such. The hotel itself is just a hotel, very average, nothing special or distinctive. Our room had a beautiful view of the city, but the room itself was not particularly nice. We only had one other Tokyo hotel experience (The Palace, which is truly 5 stars), and it just did not measure up on any level. The room was fairly small with an outdated and small bathroom, with a minimum number of towels provided, only instant coffee with paper cups, no special amenities whatsoever-whatsoever! We also had the breakfast buffet one morning. The food was okay, but it was a total mob scene and minimal, although friendly, service (we had to specifically ask to have our table cleared). Our one interaction with the concierge, when we were on our way out for lunch and asked for sushi recommendations. We were sent to 2 different places, one which was closed and being remodeled and the other which required reservations. There was no offer to make reservations, something that really should have been offered or mentioned. I could go on how the rooms were uninspired, had no turn-down service, robes and zero special amenities or that there were no cloth napkins used during breakfast, and I say all this not to sound like a snob, but so that there are real expectations of what you're getting and what you're not getting, which are things that you typically expect from a 5-star hotel. Yes, the people who work here are friendly and helpful and the bed was comfortable. They also provide a shuttle to the station, which was a nice perk, but I wish the hotel was billed more in line with what it is. If you want a luxurious experience or even a higher-end of service, this would not be the hotel for you.

Just had one of my best hotel check in experiences delivered by Miss Rinna Kato. Learning that it was my first time in Tokyo, she took the time to go through my Hilton Honor’s benefits in detail as well as providing an overview of Shinjuku area and Hilton’s complimentary shuttle service. Rinna also went through the rooms in their system to get me the earliest one available due to my early arrival. Truly looking forward to my stay at Hilton given the top notch first impression.

Comfortable stay with ample sized room. There is a very good quality gym/spa area. For foreigners, the pool is not particularly welcoming as you have to wear a swim Cap and it is cold, but the spa makes up for it for those looking to relax. Staff friendly and helpful with directions and tourist suggestions. The nearest underground train station makes it easy to travel around, but the location is not especially accommodating for those wanting to walk this area of Tokyo. There isn’t very much in the immediate vicinity and Shinjuku is a good 20-25 minutes. Would recommend for those looking for larger rooms in Tokyo, but not necessarily for the proximity to major areas to visit.

This Hotel located in Nishi shinjuku only 5 - 10 minute walking to Shinjuku entertainment area or if you dont want to walk just take the shuttle that Hilton provide. and this hotel also have Airport limousine bus drop off point so dont worry if you want to go to airport just ask to the concierge. and on this hotel all room are good with a japanese touch such as the window is really authentic japan.

We came to this hotel for five days as part of our trip to Japan.This hotel was a very good choice as it is close to all metro stations and Shinjuku. The hotel offers a shuttle into town which is only 8 minute drive. If you have got breakfast included it’s well worth it as there is a great variety.This is a great choice as part of a trip to Tokyo.

I stayed for 6 nights while attending meetings. Excellent service by an English speaking staff makes thus a welcoming place to stay in the Shinjuku district. To the south is the business district and to the north and east is a shopping and entertainment district. There is easy access to the subway from the hotel. My room was comfortable with a king bed, desk, and lounge chair and ottoman. The bath included a toilet with heated seat and great water pressure in the shower. The heated mirror behind the sink stayed clear of condensation, and there is good lighting. The wardrobe includes a safe and two pairs of slippers in addition to two robes to use while staying. Sliding panels are used to cover the widows with paper panels to diffuse the light and solid panels to darken the room. The hotel has several restaurants featuring a variety of works cuisines. The restaurant in the lobby featured an amazing breakfast buffet to satisfy both eastern and western tastes. Across the street is a large green park with trees and play areas. There is also a Starbucks Coffee and a Denny’s across the street. This hotel is a comfortable place to stay in Tokyo.

I’ve stayed here twice. Once I had a normal Hilton room and the other in an executive room. The difference in rooms appears to be the shower layout and access to the executive lounge. I’m not sure I would recommend paying for the executive room. The executive lounge is really good for breakfast, coffee and drinks. The midday tea and evening snacks are basic. The staff had a hard time keeping the food replenished and the hot dishes were barely warm. The hotel staff are pleasant and the room was clean. The bed was a little hard but comfortable. The restaurant prices are high so I recommend going elsewhere to eat. There is a Starbucks within a block.

This is a well appointed hotel in typical Hilton style. Friendly staff who speak English and a great location. The main servery for breakfast provides plenty of options ranging from cold cuts to chef made omelettes. The rooms were spacious (I had a king single) and the service was excellent. About 750 metre walk to the main Shinjuku shopping area. If I go back to Japan I am staying here!

Hilton was everything you’d expect a chain hotel to be. Clean, good service, nice rooms. Great service too, buses to / from Haneda airport and Shinjuku Sta. Utmost convenience and service. Hilton was very good at lodging many guests comfortably. But it was low on the charm factor. These days i have a lot more to enjoy fromsmaller hotels that have time to spend on details: art, interiors, curated retail.

The hotel was fantastic. Very luxurious. Friendly service, excellent size and clean rooms. Very comfortable bed. Great choice for breakfast. Dinner selection was great.The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from main shopping district, but they have a shuttle that runs until 11pm and train station is very close.

We loved the hotel. It may have been pricey but it was worth it, the rooms were huge! the staff were great. Awesome location and easy to get around from. There was a shuttle bus to the station, however we didnt use it as didnt know until the last day. But it looked easy. The pool was great and the Would stay here again.

I have stayed at many luxury properties around the world, and I’ve done so because that’s what I’ve wanted, LUXURY. Well that’s missing from this hotel. It is an average average hotel. I had specially booked a room with a king bed, and on check in I was told that I had a room with a king bed. Well after waiting for a long time for a check in, as you’ve to line up for it. Its literally a noisy, loud fish market in the lobby. You have to find your way through the people to get to reception (with your bags, no they don’t have anyone taking your bags off you). Then after the check in we get to our room, and there are two single beds. On calling the reception, we are told apologetically that they will send someone to “join the two beds together”. Well, we could do that ourselves, if we had asked for a king bed then we should get a king bed, not two single beds joined together. The bedroom itself was big considering TOKYO standards. The carpet is plush but old. The beds themselves were ok but the pillows lacked memory foam. The air conditioner worked ok but I couldn’t find a remote to control it. The TV had mostly Asian channels with just a couple in English. The bathroom itself was pretty average. It was small considering the size of the room. The shower is in the bath and not separate, with a very flimsy screen, that whenever we used it the water would splat from our body and it made the floor wet. Did not like it, so called up the reception again. No resolution was offered. We had to make do every time by mopping up the floor with the bath towels. There were no bath robes provided in the room. On request we got them the next day. We went to the pool and gym to take a look, and the staff member there told us that we will have to remove our shoes to go in there?? We were only taking a look and not dipping our feet with our shoes on!!On the last day we requested that we be given an extra hour for check out as we had a late flight. They said we could get only half an hour. Well, so we planned accordingly and were about to step out, then we were told that the room was required so only “15 minutes” were possible. So we didn’t go anywhere, as we had the housekeeping supervisor standing outside, knocking on the door, hurrying us to leave. We rushed out, lined up for our check out and that was that!!YEAH, SO I DONT THIINK WE WILL BE COMING BACK TO THE HILTON IN A HURRY!!

I hate noisy and crowded places. This is the worst.I came with my wife for a business trip of her. The hotel is ok, just ok, as for premises and service quality but the number of people everywhere is just overwhelming.You have to wait for minutes to get on the elevator and there is noise and people pushing you around everywhere.I am switching hotels for the rest of my stay.
user_name:
juangB8860DY
Long Island City, New York

review_body: The hotel seemed to be bursting at the seams. Even the Exec Lounge was very busy. Otherwise a good hotel with plenty of variety at breakfast, a comfortable bed and a concierge service. However, the crowds made it unpleasant with lifts too full, breakfast lines too long and the lobby so crowded it was uncomfortable.

I’ve stayed at this hotel many times over the past 20 years. The pluses are great service, decent location (free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station) with access to good restaurants in and around the hotel. However, it is increasingly overwhelmed by tour groups staying at the hotel which causes massive lines on check-in/out, significant waiting times at the main breakfast restaurant and generally a harassed feeling when in the hotel. Also, request a room away from the elevator banks because despite best efforts to sound proof, you will hear the mechanical noise of the system throughout the night. There are other equally good hotels in the immediate vicinity so if you are looking for alternatives...

The reception was fantastic. Our interactions with the great professionals in the hotel was beautiful. Great services & food in the executive lounge. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is clean & centrally located to most activities.

This property exemplifies Hilton quality and hospitality. We arrived mid-morning and the front desk staff gave us an option of waiting for an upgraded room (due to Diamond status) or taking the standard room we had booked. In order to get settled, we chose to take the standard room which was appointed very well. The property is located extremely close to three metro stations. If using the Marunouchi Line, bypass the Shinjuku station and use the Nishi-Shinjuku station (M07) as there is an exit that takes you right into the lower level of the Hilton. The Executive Lounge is one of the best I have encountered at any hotel property both in size and food / beverage selection. There are multiple restaurants onsite, highly suggest reservations due to their popularity.

We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel as very good. The hotel was very busy with queues for breakfast and twice we went to the restaurants without a reservation and had to wait considerably. The hotel shuttle bus to Shinjuku train station is handy and it also has undergound access to 2 metro stations so it is very accessible for sightseeing around Tokyo. The room was fine though there was no turn down service or replenishment of drinking water. I tend to expect this of 5 star hotels. Staff service was good and helpful.
user_name:
Clive888
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: We are half way through our stay here and are very comfortable in writing this review. Arrival / check in - Once arrived, we were greeted by the staff and our bags were held until check in was complete. We were checked in by Ernesto who was simply amazing and has a great personality. He didn't just check us in and move onto the next person. Ernesto recognised my Hilton Honors Diamond Status and did his best to upgrade us though the lobby and the hotel seemed extremely busy. He was able to work his magic and upgraded us to the 37th floor though the room wasn't ready so he went above and beyond and gave us a temporary sleep room for a few hours. We felt extremely well looked after and could tell he did his best to accommodate us. Location - Located in the business district of Shinjuku , this hotel is situated near a train station metres away and offers a free shuttle 3 times per hour to the main Shinjuku entrance. Room - We were upgraded to a king suite on the 37th floor (due to Diamond status) . The suite size is more than enough for 2 people, with 2 bathrooms and a make up room, massive amounts of luggage storage , 2 toilets, a lounge area and a MASSIVE bed! Water pressure is adequate and pillow selection is fantastic. Housekeeping have done an amazing job, extremely thorough and more than enough high quality amenities. Executive Lounge - My status allowed lounge access which has been very handy though the lounge can get very busy in the mornings and at evenings though is a real first world problem. Staff are very accommodating in these busy periods. Food on offer is wide range of hot and cold dishes ( depending of time of day) . Lots of non alcoholic and alcoholic drinks available though if I can suggest something, it's to upgrade the coffee machines as they aren't great and are super noisy. Note - This Hotel doesn't have a welcome pack for Diamond Members though we have been offered 2 x free drinks at their cocktail lounge which is more than sufficient. The hotel also offer well priced airport transfers which to be honest, is worth taking instead of battling with the trains. Breakfast - The buffet breakfast can get very busy but the staff work extremely quickly to turnover tables to ensure you are seated as fast as possible. A great wide range of food accommodating to various cultures ; salad bar, cold meats, asian delicacies , western food and all in between.Overall our stay so far has been memorable. A big thank you to the Ernesto and the staff here who have made our stay an experience we won't forget.Should we return to Tokyo , there is only one place we will stay and that's at the Hilton.

We stayed at the Hilton in Shinjuku area and were very happy with the great location and true 5 star quality of this hotel. Located about 10 minutes away from the Shinjuku train station, one of largest networked train stations in Tokyo. Also adjacent to the station is the main shopping area in Shinjuku. Hotel couldn’t be faulted. Great breakfast and choice of restaurants. With so many food outlets in the area the hotel restaurants didn’t have much of a chance! Definitely recommend for holidays or business travel. A little on the expensive side, but it’s Japan.

We made several stops in Japan but the Hilton Tokyo Shinjuku was the nicest hotel. The room was clean, spacious and have every amenity. We got upgraded so we got fee breakfast at the 37th floor lounge, everything made to order and freshly squeezed OJ, even the honey has a real cut section of bee hive............ fantastic. The buffet in the lobby was above and beyond; they were already prepared for Halloween. We also had to eat the Japanese Wagu/Kobe steaks at the Metropolitan restaurant. The hotel provided a free bus service to/back the shopping district and Shinjuku subway station twice an hour which was a really nice touch and made getting around very easy.Top notch luxury hotel, the staff is INCREDIBLE and help with your every need.

After a 12 hour flight from SFO a 20 minute bus to the Tokyo Hilton was nothing. Staff took charge of our every need from the moment we stepped off the bus. We were told not to worry about our luggage as they would "find us". We were guided to a special Hilton Honors check in by passing a rather long line. We had a Japanese beer and champagne respectfully placed in our hands and check in and tomorrows breakfast reservation was complete. A step over to a table in the lounge became our resting spot for the next hour or so with the most beautiful views of Tokyo from the 37th floor. We were treated to samples of Japanese and European food and an open bar. We enjoyed our arrival but even all the wonderful special treatment the jet lag started to hit us. We made it to our room where our bags had already found us. I must say it is one of the most amazing places we have ever stayed. Clean, large room with a very high Tech potty that I will have to check out You Tube for instructions. Fun fun fun. We love this place!

This hotel never ceases to amaze me. I feel totally spoiled and pampered whenever I stay there. The staff goes over and above anything you will encounter in the US. They make it their job to anticipate your every need before you even recognize that you need it, The executive lounge is spectacular. The personnel are friendly and professional. They make you feel like you are part of the family and will make every effort to accommodate. The restaurants are great and the breakfast buffet has every food imaginable.I cannot compliment the hotel and its staff enough. They are great and will make your stay in Tokyo the best you will ever experience.

We had 2 rooms from 28th sept to 30th sept. I feel the hotel is a rip off due to the high tariffs and small room size and condition. The rooms and the facilities are pretty old.I was not at all happy with the price that I payed for this category of hotel. I would definitely not recommend it.

My husband and I had 2 weeks at this hotel. The service, staff and facilities were fantastic. The hotel is in the business district of Shin juku. It’s close to the subway so you can get to anywhere from it. In fact, one subway entrance is right below the hotel. It offers a great breakfast and has 3 wonderful restaurants. A bistro, Japanese and Chinese options. There’s also a groovy bar called Zatta which serves food all day. The guy in charge at Zatta was amazing. His name was Florian Clement. It also has great pillows, the bed is fabulous and the rooms are really quiet, and the sliding blinds ensure a dark room for an extra long sleep in.

Stayed in the Hilton Tokyo for a business trip for the first time and found it exceeded my expectations. The room was clean, comfortable, and had a great view. The restaurants provided excellent food, service, and convenience. I definitely plan to stay again on my next trip to the area.
user_name:
Will M
Wake Forest, North Carolina

review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights in 2 rooms with our grown up sons. It is a nice hotel in a Shinjuku but it is quite a walk to the station and shops. I felt it was a little isolated and we ended up getting taxis everywhere. We thought being close to Harajuka it would be easy to get there but in fact it was on a different line which required changing and a very long walk between platforms. We love Tokyo however, but next time will go back to Shibuya where you can walk everywhere.

Staying at Hilton Shinjuku is always a piece of mind. It starts from as early as arriving at any of the two the Airport. The Airport Limousine bus will take you directly to the hotel.Check-in is a breeze and at ease although it is a busy hotel, greeted with courtesy and efficiency. I stayed in the Executive suite room, it is a large and modern room with a great view of the Shinjuku city. The hotel has some good restaurants and bar, it is a popular dining place among the local Japanese.The hotel is in the best location in Shinjuku nest to a big park. It is about 10 to 15 minutes walk to the Shinjuku station. Its a good place to base your stay in Tokyo. This is one of my favourite hotel in Tokyo.

Great hotel - has everything you need. Shuttle to Shinkinju or can walk to the metro under the hotel connected to main lines. Definitely large and busy - but so great when your airline loses your luggage for a day (like ours did) - handled everything wonderfully. We even went in for the large pricey breakfast - as it was so good and varied in its offerings. We used the pool and the great gym - a great treat to start our trip to Japan (and also recover from jet lag.) Highly recommend.

Stayed initially 4 nights.HH Gold member perks- Upgraded to a really nice room & breakfast. Daily water bottle top up. Exec lounge access.Room was excellent Bathroom very nice Gym 24 hours very goodSauna / Japanese bath very good ( no shorts allowed....) men’s and Ladies are separate.Breakfast was excellent (amazing poached eggs) wide selection of food / juices breakfasts included Japanese & chineseStaff are excellent@this hotel. Very close to a subway (Nishi Shinjuku-Ku) you can walk underground to the hotel or on the street literally a few mins. Took a bus from the Narita airport this hotel was the last stop it took about 1.5 hours - when we left took a taxi to Shinjuku station and train to the airport very easy! Next time on arrival I would take the train to Shinjuku station and a taxi to the hotel it’s not very far.As a tourist this hotel is ideally located everything was easy to get to via subway. A couple of days in the evening walked to Shinjuku station about 15 mins away - good walk. There are some food courts in the buildings near the hotel didn’t go as we were always out & about.Had a totally amazing time. Stayed 4 nights then went to Kyoto for a few nights & returned to the Hilton Tokyo for one night before flying out (no upgrade/ exec lounge access for the one night on return)

We stayed here for a few nights at the start of our holiday in Japan and it worked really well for us. The views from our rooms were stunning and the hotel was clean, comfortable and efficient but noticeably busy at times.We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast but found dining in the hotel really quite expensive and headed out to nearby restaurants after the first night.The location is good and the frequent free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station invaluable

I checked in to the Hilton Tokyo because of our group event. I had a great stay. the room was comfortable, clean, and well appointed. the bed is super comfy. The lounge was ok in term of food selection for breakfast st and nightly hot food. Chiharu at the Executive Lounge was very helpful and always has a smile on her.The gym was a bit disappointing. very limited weight training equipment.The elevator was very packed most of the time and it takes a long time. maybe the hotel should divide the elevators between high floors and lower flowers. that will really help.

My husband and I felt that the room was nice sized in terms of Japanese hotels and the hotel is definitely a western-style hotel. Hotel is a great location with inside access to the subway, shops and restaurants, and is next to the park, the government building and walking distance to the heart of Shinjuku. The staff is also extremely helpful and accommodating. In terms of rate, we felt the rate was very good for the luxury feel of the hotel and accommodation. One other note, we needed to leave our bags while we traveled around Japan, and the hotel was happy to oblige at no additional cost.

Pleasant experience started as soon as we stepped out of our shuttle bus!We were met with friendly, happy staff who guided us to check-in to which was hassle free. We had parcels waiting for us and they were delivered to the room 10minutes after we arrived.The rooms were spacious and very clean. Dark in the mornings too!Buffet breakfast down stairs catered for everyone including those with allergies. We had 2 of our girls with us aged 12 & 13 and they loved the selection too.The concierge couldn’t help you enough.I needed medical attention due to chest infection and they organised a clinic to expect our visit, put us into a Taxi and explained where he was to take me. We were met by medical staff as soon as we reached the door and I was whisked in and seen to immediately thanks to the concierge!I wouldn’t hesitate in staying there next time I was in Tokyo.A very good experience indeed.

This is a huge and busy hotel that has all you would expect from the Hilton brand. It is located a bit away from the tourist hotspots but there is a subway station beneath the hotel and also a free shuttle bus to and from Shinjuku station where there is also lots of shopping. Our room was huge and very comfortable with great views. I believe some of the rooms must have views of Mt Fuji on a clear day - you can certainly see it from the club lounge on the 37th floor. The lounge is a bit crowded at times but service there is excellent. Probably would be better to leave it open after 9pm so guests can have a cup of coffee etc. There is also a bus service to the airport for guests. This is a big saving on a taxi fare. All in all a very good hotel and would certainly return.

Back to this venerable hotel after two years and little has changed. The heavy equipment of the gym (only has six machines) has been moved poolside. While that made room for additional treadmills the heavy section is now under a glass roof which can heat up quickly. The room was spacious but the bathroom was narrow making it difficult to use (for a tall guy) without hitting something. The bathroom had however, all the amenities common in Japan (including a fresh toothbrush every day).Internet is available at a fee (slow speed free for Hilton Honors members) but in this year 2018 it would be nice if they could equip their rooms directly with USB Jacks rather than the conventional electricity Jacks. We also used the 7th floor beer garden but were not impressed (having been spoiled by beer gardens in Germany recently).

Stayed at the hilton, beatiful inside, accomdated us for our stay. Great location friendly staff, comfortable rooms. Awesome buffet breakfast with a variety of food. Loved our stay here would Def stay again

Stayed at the Hilton Tokyo in Shinjuku. It has everything you could want, restaurants, bars, a Spa. I had a room on the 22nd that overlooked an office building. The room was good , the shower fabulous only it had a single beds which wasn’t to my liking. As it was booked as part of a group booking there wasn’t a lot they could do. This seem to be code for the hotel to throw their arms in the air and say sorry in Japanese. Overall the hotel met our expectations. However the greed from the bar management spoiled the night on two occasions. We took 28 people into the cigar bar on the second night and to save time and assist the understaffed bar, we ordered a bottle of whiskey, a bottle Bourbon and two bottles of Red Wine. Trust me they weren’t rare vintages or varieties . The upshot is that no discount was given for serving ourselves and the bottles were charged on a per glass basis on what the bottle held. Yep that’s a rip off. Cost $1500 plusSecond instant involved some friends at the bar who ordered two whiskies and 4 beers. The Barman held up a bottle of Japanese Whisky to see if it was acceptable, my friend nodded okay. The bill for one round of drinks for six people $360 AUD. I stay at Hilton Hotel several times a year. This instance isn’t commonplace but it was still disappointing.

Top location that Metro just step down a few from hotel lobby. Surprised! Pro service and yummy food specially the breakfast buffet, even just an half boiled egg. Costly than other but worth a penny of your pocket.

The Hilton Hotel Tokyo is a five star hotel. The hotel is connected to the metro which is very convenient. The hotel has a wide variety of restaurants to choose from, booking is recommended. The hotel is well positioned and a short walk to Roppongi. This hotel is suitable for business and leisure guests.

Great hotel. I had a very good experience starting from check-in. Great customer service, clean room, excellent breakfast buffet and nice location. Nice shops and restaurants (including a nice Indian restaurant) in the basement.
user_name:
ncm-67
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Sent 2 nights at the Hilton and had an incredible experience. We were fortunate enough to have a suite on the penthouse level, and one of the days was so clear we could see the top of Mount Fuji from our room.The suite was lovely and the shower/tub room was especially incredible. We also enjoyed the offerings in both the Executive Lounge and the Diamond Lounge. The Executive Level check-in was also appreciated, as we were able to avoid the main lobby check-in completely. The service was impeccable throughout our stay. Good location, as well. We will be back!
user_name:
d_hops
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Having stayed here for a stopover last year and having a wonderful experience, I decided a longer stay this year. Top marks to the Hilton Tokyo in terms of service, cleanliness, safety, and value. This time I picked a junior suite with club access and would recommend this. Suite was spacious and the only downside seems to be their bathroom which was a “standard size” compared to other suites I’ve stayed in other hotels. Location is slightly off the main tourist belt but there’s a free shuttle bringing you to Shinjuku station or you can take the underground link (about 20mins Walk) to the station. Club lounge - definitely a must for cocktails, refreshment breaks, or just coffee and light breakfast. We were given access to full buffet breakfast to the main restaurant as well as the Japanese restaurant , Junisoh. If your stay includes breakfast there, I highly recommend trying it; a culinary experience. Portions are small and modest . Hilton Tokyo is my hotel of choice in Shinjuku.

It is nice to return to a hotel and know everything will be exceptional, no surprises. Only getting and receiving what is expected.....what a nice concept. From the friendly greeting from the door person, to the welcome home from the bellman....nice.

Good hotel... good breakfast... I wonder why hotels don’t think about people who are vegetarian or vegan. Not many options but overall a good experience. I was not upgraded even though I am a Diamond member. It’s a very busy hotel because it’s close to all the fun
user_name:
karns743
New York Mills, New York

review_body: I will have to say that the Executive Lounge here is one of the best in the world. They are extremely friendly and pay attention to every detail. This is one of my favorite hotels in the world and I travel a lot. I want to point out that Tomoko in the executive lounge was exceptionally friendly and provided first class service. She is amazing!

Have been here for several days. The location is excellent to travel anywhere in Tokyo. Staff are extremely helpful and they speak very good english(its strange that in 2018 the city of Tokyo has a barrier language, most of the people on stores, restaurants and elsewhere don't speak English. Only in this city have a seen this phenomenon. Even in India they speak fluently and are very nice trying to understand you're needs as a tourist. Very happy and would definitely come back, good moneys worth for what they offer. Breakfast in the Lobby is Superb with a lot to chose from and great service and a very fare price!!
user_name:
fidelaga
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

review_body: While this hotel is in Shinjuku, it's still about a 15 min walk to the main train station or to downtown. It was very busy and I felt rushed by staff. They didn't take time to explain facilities or the benefits I had as a Hilton Loyalty Member. In fact, when free wi-fi was denied to me, I had to remind them that it's a benefit I had and they re-looked into my status.

It's a Hilton, so there is a standard here. We stayed here the first night we landed in Tokyo and booked on the Executive Level. The rooms were amazing with great views, and the service was excellent. There is a free shuttle to Shinjuku Station that puts you right near the action...Golden Gai, Memory Lane, and more. It's actually only a 5-10 minute walk, but it may be hard to get your bearings when you are jet lagged.The happy hour and breakfast in the Executive Lounge were the highlights. A perfect little stop to imbibe and snack before you head out on the town, and I ate so much at breakfast that I did not need lunch. The people were super nice and I'm sure the other facilities (restaurants and gym) were amazing, but we just wanted to explore.The hotel was so great, we had one undecided night in Tokyo at the end and re-booked. The only issue is that the bus to the airport has the Hilton as the first stop , so you end up spending 20-30 minutes driving in circles around a 4 block radius picking up other guests before actually going to the airport, but that has nothing to do with the hotel. Take the shuttle to Shinjuku Station and catch the Narita Express.

Perfect stay on Hilton Points as a Diamond Member, from check-in welcome to departing check-out. Loved the various breakfast options, Executive Lounge, Marble Cafe, or Japanese Breakfast offered. Great location to Shijuku station, and the shuttle there really helps! Accomodations were great and hotel has a lot of guests, but did not impact my stay at all. A perfect stay! Thanks to all the hotel employees I encountered!!

It's a bit of a walk from the main Shinjuku station but the hotel is very nice -- comfortable, clean, modern rooms. I asked for a high floor and they gave me the top floor -- 38th -- which had a great view of the surrounding area, though it was a bit scary during an earthquake at 5 a.m! Lots of places to eat in walking distance. Save $ on breakfast and eat across the street at the Royal Host (think Denny's, with pictures & english on menu). Fitness center and pool are great, with an Onsen to relax in after.
user_name:
Joshua G
New York City, New York

review_body: We paid an extra 150 cad per night to use the executive lounge, and felt it was not worth the money. The food offered at bfst is good, but the selection is too small. We got bored quite quickly. The Japanese bfst is a nice touch, but again, boring after having it twice because it changes only slightly. The evening food, however, is just AWFUL! It's poor quality food, usually with very little or very low quality protein. The red and white wine are not drinkable, except for the sparkling, but again, it gets boring very quickly. They offer Asahi and Heineken, which was good and always plentiful.The room was nice, very clean. The yukatas were a nice touch. The hallways have a very strong perfume odor which would was not a nice scent and way too strong.I would not stay here again.

Service, like many Japanese places, is great. From pre-arrival questions to baggage handling, you can depend on them.The location is pretty convenient. The closest Metro station is Nishi (West) Shijuku (M07) followed by Tochōmae (In front of Tokyo Metro Government) Station (E28). Both are connected by underground tunnel (just turn different ways when you enter the tunnel). If you need to find your way in the Tokyo Metro System, I find it is easiest to go by the station numbers. This way, you can quickly find ways to transfer and calculate the number of stops. The E line is sort of a loop (shaped like a sideways 6 or 9) so you can go to a lot of places on it once you realize the case. Tochōmae is actually where the loop splits and trains go essentially 3 different directions from there.The hotel offers a shuttle to the Shinjuku station and it is a 15-20 minute walk if you don't get lost. The Tokyo Metro Government is 2 blocks away and has a free observatory on the 45th(?) floor that opens well into the evening.Tried breakfast at the Lounge, downstairs restaurant and the Japanese breakfast. The Japanese breakfast was served very fast and efficiently so it did not take much time. Restaurant has a lot of food but is really busy. Lounge is a more relaxed environment for breakfast. Afternoon tea has lots of desserts. Evening offering is OK and it is really busy.One thing I do not like is at some of the food stations (both in the lounge and in the restaurant), there was not a place for utensils. So, people put the utensils right on top of the food. It is not sanitary.The gym has a swimming pool, tennis court and sauna.The room is nice and it seems pretty new. I got a city view room and enjoyed the view. The shower setup is great and the water pressure is good. The bed, although hard by western standards, is very comfortable. My big problem with the room was the smell of smoke. Otherwise, I would have given the hotel a 5 star. The other issue was you can hear the elevator rolling up and down the shaft. Since I got an early check-in, I really don't want to be a pain and get them to move me.

I visit Tokyo 4 or 5 times per year on business and will generally always stay at Hilton Tokyo or Hilton Tokyo Odaiba depending on which has the better rate for the dates I am staying, as these rates can fluctuate massively. This time Hilton Tokyo offered the better rate..As a Hilton Diamond member I was upgraded to an executive room on a high floor, and due to the unusual shape of the building, my room this time was larger than usual which was very pleasing. Oddly they had put a card in my room thanking me for spending my "special anniversary" there, which was surprising as I was on a business trip, but it did make me smile!!!The gym at this hotel has recently improved quite a lot and now has separate areas for free weights, cardio and machines, allowing for a good workout. The location is exceptional, a short walk from Shinjuku station (regular courtesy bus is also available), and an underground route to Tochomae station which is well connected on the underground train network, so it's actually very easy to access pretty much anywhere in the city. Another major selling point is that the lounge offers free beer ALL day, not that I'm one to abuse such a facility..Check out in the lounge is very smooth, and you can also buy a ticket for the airport limousine bus there but I recommend booking the bus ticket in advance as these fill up quickly..

The service in this hotel is exceptional. Because of my diamond status we were upgraded to a suite and this was an amazing room. Breakfast was one of the best I've ever had with pretty much everything you would want.

Classy hotel in Shinjuku close to everything but still gives you a sanctuary from the madness of Tokyo at the end of the day.Free shuttle to Shinjuku station and underground links to 2 subway stops so no issues no matter the weather.Looking forward to my next stay there in a couple of days

Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of our Japan and China travel programme. A great choice, the staff were first rate the food was excellent and hotel generally had a great vibe. The hotel is in a great location and runs a regular, short, on time (every 20 mins) shuttle bus to the Shinjuku (station) this part of town a truly great area to explore and experience. The shuttle bus was welcome as it was hot and humid in August. The transport links round and about are great to (two Metro stations nearby) and we decided to take the Limobus from Narita Airport to the Hotel which is the last stop. It is simple to use and really hassle free, no changing trains etc and welcomed this after a long flight from the UK. Time door to door circa 2 hours. Good restaurants in hotel but menus are pricey, however the are a good selection of restaurants and coffee bars close by but these are not to obvious as they are one level below street level and there primarily to serve the offices. These shops and restaurants (varied selection, grills, Japanese, Chinese and more) are typically set around large amenity areas/ squares but are not evident on first sight, but worth seeking out. One such amenity area is in the adjacent block 50m from the hotel. Had a couple of great meals in good quality restaurants at a reasonable price. This Hilton is one of the best I have stayed at around the globe, very busy, but just a great team and no hassles.
